verbose_text: This apparent paradox between the effects of the endogenous and exogenous (transfected) p53 and the high expression of p53 could be explained by several mechanisms : by the presence of mutant p53, by the presence of dominant negative spliced variants, by a resistance to proteolytic degradation of p53, by an accelerated nuclear export or an inhibition of nuclear import and/or by sequestration of p53 in a complex through binding to other proteins.
